medical_history.chief_complaint: Mass in the left frontal and left parietal lobes.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient began experiencing clumsiness of the right upper arm and difficulty with coordination activities 4 weeks before presentation. Two weeks later, symptoms persisted, leading him to seek evaluation. At the time of admission, he reported ongoing clumsiness and weakness in the right arm for 4 weeks, with no other symptoms.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of melanoma of the left shoulder, excised 4 years prior with negative lymph node biopsy and no additional therapy.
medical_history.family_history: Mother died of colon cancer at 72; father died of an unknown cause in his 30s.
medical_history.social_history: Smoked a few cigars per week for the past 10 years; did not consume alcohol or use illicit drugs. Worked as an executive and lived with his wife, splitting time between Florida and New England.
